abstract.p: Mark Martin wins California 500 auto race (S)

block.p: A year ago, Mark Martin saw his chance to win the inaugural California 500 in Fontana disappear when he had to make a late stop for gas. Yesterday, he had more than enough to put away the rest of the field for his third victory of the season.

''This was a redemption for last year,'' the driver from Arkansas said after leading 165 of the 250 laps on the two-mile banked oval. Martin averaged 140.220 miles an hour on the way to the 25th victory of his Winston Cup career.

A year ago, Mark Martin saw his chance to win the inaugural California 500 in Fontana disappear when he had to make a late stop for gas. Yesterday, he had more than enough to put away the rest of the field for his third victory of the season.

''This was a redemption for last year,'' the driver from Arkansas said after leading 165 of the 250 laps on the two-mile banked oval. Martin averaged 140.220 miles an hour on the way to the 25th victory of his Winston Cup career.

The winner took the lead for the final time on Lap 206, during the final round of green-flag pit stops, and beat the new series points leader, Jeremy Mayfield, to the finish line by 1.287 seconds -- about 15 car lengths.
